main event: Unidentified Flying Objects were observed near March Air Force Base in Southern California on various dates in 1949 and 1952.
interesting points: The objects were oval-shaped and left no vapor trail, and no sound or propulsion system was noted.
One report mentioned that the object was visible only while in the sun's rays and estimated to be traveling at a speed of 250 to 300 miles per hour.
There were multiple credible witnesses, including Air Force airmen and Sergeant George F. Fuller from the 807th Supply Squadron.
The objects were observed at high altitudes, estimated to be 25,000 to 30,000 feet.
The objects moved at high speeds, much faster than any known aircraft, and disappeared upon leaving the sun's rays.
location: March Air Force Base, Southern California
witnesses: Air Force airmen, Sergeant George F. Fuller from the 807th Supply Squadron, A/2C Darrell Clarkson
